history.content:
Hi, I’m a CS and applied math double major. Next semester will be my last semester, and I’m thinking about what to take.

I’m going to take EECS 127 for sure.

I’d like to take one more class just for the sake of learning. I’m done with all of my requirements so my schedule is really flexible.

Here is my background:

Interesting classes I’ve taken and done well: 

CS 61A, B, 70, 170, 188, 189
MATH 110, 113, 185
EECS 126 (currently enrolled in right now)
STAT 153

Not as interesting classes I’ve taken and done (decently) well:

CS 161, 168, 186
MATH 104

Classes I’ve taken and done not very well:

CS 61C, 162
EE 40 (This is the circuit introductory EE class before the 16 series)
STAT 134, 135 (Thus I’m taking EE 126 to relearn the materials)

I’m currently doing robotics research.

I’m planning to attend graduate school in the future.

Here is what I have in my mind (going to choose 1 from all these options):

Control Theory: 

EE 120, 128

Since I’m doing robotics research and I have 0 knowledge about signals and control, it will be good to have them under my belt.

I have heard that EE 128 is the class that teaches control theory. However, I haven’t taken EE 120 yet and it’s a prerequisite of EE 128. Is it possible to jump straight into EE 128 with no knowledge of signals? I’m willing to self study some materials over winter break and I think my math background is relatively strong.

Low-Level Programming:

CS 152

I’d like to relearn the materials I didn’t master in 61C and 162. It may not be as relevant to what I’d like to do in the future, but I would like to “redeem myself” in a sense, as I’m a better student now than I was when I was in those classes.

Not very interested in CS 164 and 182. Open to other suggestions as well.

Thanks for all input in advance!
history.subject: Classes to take next semester?
